channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The skein valued mirror of the topological vertex
item.description: arXiv:2412.15454v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We count holomorphic curves in complex 3-space with boundaries on three special Lagrangian solid tori. The count is valued in the HOMFLYPT skein module of the union of the tori. Using 1-parameter families of curves at infinity, we derive three skein valued operator equations which must annihilate the count, and which dequantize to a mirror of the geometry. We show algebraically that the resulting equations determine the count uniquely, and that the result agrees with the topological vertex from topological string theory.
item.dc:creator: Tobias Ekholm, Pietro Longhi, Vivek Shende

item.title: Khovanov homology and Lagrangian cobordisms
item.description: arXiv:2412.15351v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We provide a partial answer to a question of Ekholm, Honda, and K\'alm\'an about the relationship between Khovanov homology and decomposable Lagrangian cobordisms. We also utilize previously defined filtered invariants to give obstructions to decomposable Lagrangian cobordisms from Khovanov homology.
item.dc:creator: Gage Martin, Ina Petkova, Zachary Winkeler

item.title: Alexander polynomials of symplectic curves and divisibility relations
item.description: arXiv:2412.15792v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove Libgober's divisibility relations for Alexander polynomials of symplectic curves in the complex projective plane. Along the way, we give new proofs of the divisibility relations for complex algebraic curves with respect to a generic line at infinity.
item.dc:creator: Hanine Awada, Marco Golla

item.title: Boundary structure of gauge and matter fields coupled to gravity
item.description: arXiv:2206.14680v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The boundary structure of $3+1$-dimensional gravity (in the Palatini-Cartan formalism) coupled to to gauge (Yang-Mills) and matter (scalar and spinorial) fields is described through the use of the Kijowski-Tulczijew construction. In particular, the reduced phase space is obtained as the reduction of a symplectic space by some first class constraints and a cohomological description (BFV) of it is presented.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Advances in Theoretical and Mathematical Physics, Vol. 28, Issue 5 (2024), pp. 1647-1727
item.dc:creator: Giovanni Canepa, Alberto S. Cattaneo, Filippo Fila-Robattino

item.title: Neck pinch singularities and Joyce conjectures in Lagrangian mean curvature flow with circle symmetry
item.description: arXiv:2305.05744v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article we consider the Lagrangian mean curvature flow of compact, circle-invariant, almost calibrated Lagrangian surfaces in hyperk\"ahler 4-manifolds with circle symmetry. We show that this Lagrangian mean curvature flow can be continued for all time, through finite time singularities, and converges to a chain of special Lagrangians, thus verifying various aspects of Joyce's conjectures in this setting. We show that the singularities of the flow are neck pinches in the sense conjectured by Joyce. We also give examples where such finite time singularities are guaranteed to occur.
item.dc:creator: Jason D. Lotay, Goncalo Oliveira

item.title: On the geometry of Lagrangian one-forms
item.description: arXiv:2412.14700v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Lagrangian multiform theory is a variational framework for integrable systems. In this article we introduce a new formulation which is based on symplectic geometry and which treats position, momentum and time coordinates of a finite-dimensional integrable hierarchy on an equal footing. This formulation allows a streamlined one-step derivation of both the multi-time Euler-Lagrange equations and the closure relation (encoding integrability). We argue that any Lagrangian one-form for a finite-dimensional system can be recast in our new framework. We also show that our new framework easily extends to non-commuting flows corresponding to nonabelian Lie groups. Thus Hamiltonian Lie group actions can be derived from a variational principle.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Caudrelier, Derek Harland
